pkgmetadata.longdescription: Joint Model of Heterogeneous Repeated Measures and Survival Data // Maximum likelihood estimation for the semi-parametric joint modeling of competing risks and longitudinal data in the presence of heterogeneous within-subject variability, proposed by Li and colleagues (2023) arXiv:2301.06584. The proposed method models the within-subject variability of the biomarker and associates it with the risk of the competing risks event. The time-to-event data is modeled using a (cause-specific) Cox proportional hazards regression model with time-fixed covariates. The longitudinal outcome is modeled using a mixed- effects location and scale model. The association is captured by shared random effects. The model is estimated using an Expectation Maximization algorithm.
